alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 6:05PM PDT until September 12 at 8:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SAN BERNARDINO AND SOUTH CENTRAL CLARK COUNTIES... At 605 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms still producing heavy rain in the Piute Wash in far southern Clark County. This water will drain south and impact Highway 95 at mile marker 70 in San Bernardino County, even though it has not rained there. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Laughlin, Searchlight and Cal-Nev-Ari. This includes the following highways... Highway 95 in Clark County between mile markers 0 and 19. Highway 95 in San Bernardino County near mile marker 70. State Route 163 in Clark County between mile markers 0 and 2. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
